title: Snap elections: Why France could become ungovernable
summary: The dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale makes many once unlikely scenarios plausible: Cohabitation with the far right or the left, the impossibility of forging alliances, or the appointment of an apolitical government to manage day-to-day affairs.

title: The thwarted car dream of the French middle class
summary: Until the 2000s, the choice of a car went hand-in-hand with a rising standard of living and a growing need for mobility, driven by urban sprawl and longer commutes. The trend stalled in 2010 when new car prices soared.

title: Two years after overturn of Roe V. Wade, US doctors are on the front line
summary: Gynecologists have had to adapt their practice and the number of students in this specialty is dropping, creating medical deserts in some parts of the country.

title: The delicate restructuring of Ukrainian debt
summary: Major asset managers are demanding that Ukraine, in the midst of war with Russia, repay its debts, even though the country desperately needs financing to ensure its defense and survival.

title: Dagestan churches and synagogues targeted by attacks after months of religious tensions
summary: At least 20 people were killed and 46 wounded, including police and civilians, in coordinated attacks on religious buildings in Makhachkala and Derbent, two cities in the Russian Caucasus republic.

title: A Scandinavian cycling epic of trolls, saunas and forests
summary: On the west coast of Sweden, a 390-kilometer bike path winds along sandy beaches, pine forests and wheat fields. It goes all the way to Denmark, where the gates open to Hamlet's castle and a spectacular museum of modern art.

title: French elections: Macron rules out resigning whatever the result
summary: In a Letter to the French published in the regional press, the president said he would remain president until 2027.

title: New Caledonia: New clashes triggered by detention of pro-independence activists in mainland France
summary: Numerous clashes between law enforcement and pro-independence forces occurred on Sunday night. The hospital is once again inaccessible, as it was at the start of the insurrection, which began six weeks ago now and seems to be spreading to the bush.

title: Paris tourism drops before the Olympics
summary: Fewer business travelers, fewer tourists. This year, the prospect of the Olympic Games has diverted a significant proportion of visitors from the capital and hotels are offering discounts.

title: France's middle class feels downgraded and is turning to the far-right
summary: Across the country, middle-class voters expressed their resentment during the June 9 European elections. Some through abstention, and many others by voting in favor of the Rassemblement National.

title: The ghost of a fascist military unit returns to haunt Italy
summary: The memory of the Decima MAS, a flotilla associated with a nationalist romanticism that exalted flamboyant violence and fed the imagination of neo-fascism in Italy, has been modernized by General Roberto Vannacci, the League's lead candidate in the EU elections.

title: South Korean battery factory fire kills Chinese migrant workers
summary: 18 Chinese migrant workers were among the 22 victims of a massive fire at a South Korean lithium battery factory, in one of the major battery-producing country's worst factory disasters in years.

title: Far-right leader Bardella says party 'ready' to govern
summary: French far-right Rassemblement National party president Jordan Bardella says the party is ready to govern should it emerge victorious from the snap elections triggered by President Macron.

title: Netanyahu says fewer troops now needed in Gaza, freeing up forces to fight on Lebanese border
summary: According to the Israeli Prime Minister, the war against Hamas is far from over, but its 'intense' phase in Gaza is nearing an end.

title: Sociologist Dominique Schnapper: 'Today, the president provokes rejection in a way that weakens our institutions'
summary: Sociologist Dominique Schnapper analyzes how the principles of freedom and equality that underpin democracy can be turned against it, which can lead to a climate of hatred and transform adversaries into enemies.

title: EU says Apple's App Store breaches digital rules
summary: In a 'preliminary view' directed at Apple, the EU Commission formally accused its App Store of violating the EU's new Digital Markets Act, the latest move in a long-running dispute between the bloc and the tech giant.

title: Victims of Kazkhstan's 'Bloody January' long for justice
summary: More than two years after the unrest of January 2022, the trials of demonstrators have continued in the dark. Hundreds of people reported acts of torture.

title: Saudi Arabia says 1,301 died during Hajj
summary: Saudia Arabia said more than 1,300 people died during this year's Hajj pilgrimage, with authorities citing extreme high temperatures for many of the deaths.
